Exchanges a quick, knowing look with Railly, indicating awareness and comprehension of the situation involving the Twelve Monkeys.
Follows Railly's gaze and processes new external information (the sight of cheetahs running past), linking it logically to the 'Army of the Twelve Monkeys' event.
Pauses and reflects on a memory about his parents and uncle before a tragedy; shares a sincere moment with Railly.
Mesmerized by the airport scenery, showing vulnerability and openness in his reaction.
Recognizes the airport and recalls a specific personal memory connected to it, showing situational awareness and mental sharpness.
Mesmerized by the airport scene and not immediately reacting to the presence of policemen nearby, possibly risking exposure.
Accepts a tool from Railly and shows concern about their situation, agreeing quickly to her plan.
Hesitates before making a phone call, then speaks very quietly and intensely.
Recognizes the danger and acknowledges he needs to fix his appearance quickly as instructed by Railly, showing situational awareness and responsiveness.
Hesitates when seeing an unoccupied phone but then makes a decision to use it, indicating thoughtful consideration before acting.
Momentarily confused or distracted when Railly mentions they may be recognized, suggesting a lapse in focus.
Speaks privately and urgently into the phone to clarify a misunderstanding about the Army of the Twelve Monkeys, showing concern for truth and others’ fate.
Looks around nervously and averts his face after finishing the call, indicating discomfort and desire for privacy rather than openness.
Washes and rewashes his hands in the men's room, drawing attention from a traveler who looks at him quizzically.
Defiantly insists on staying in the men's room despite being told he doesn't belong there, showing persistence but causing unease to others.
Engages in a tense and somewhat hostile exchange with an unseen voice, refusing to back down.
Carefully checks the men's room before applying adhesive to his moustache to maintain his disguise.
Challenges an unseen voice defiantly despite uncertainty and isolation.
Is dismayed and confused when he fails to identify 'the voice' or confirm if it was real.
Resists taking a gun from Jose, showing reluctance to escalate violence.
Appears shaken and paranoid, avoids confrontation initially by keeping his head down.
Engages cautiously but reactively with a former acquaintance who pressures him.
Resists impulsively taking a gun from Jose despite pressure, showing caution and control in a tense moment.
Appears nervous and paranoid after leaving the restroom, indicating vulnerability or lack of confidence.
Shows concern and resignation when Jose reveals threat to Railly, accepting responsibility despite danger.
Hurries back toward the Gift Shop, indicating urgency and protective instinct toward Railly.
Stops in his tracks, stunned and unable to speak when confronted by Jose with a gun and threats.
Accepts the gun resignedly, recognizing he has no leverage in this moment.
Calmly questions the nature of the confrontation, understanding it is about obedience rather than the virus.
Says 'I love you, Kathryn' with a look of doom in his eyes, showing sincere affection and vulnerability.
Expresses love and concern to Railly before being pulled into security, showing emotional awareness but no direct action toward the goal at this moment.
Is hurried by Railly toward the security checkpoint swiftly, indicating some cooperation and urgency but no decisive independent action in this segment.
Intervenes when the security officer jabs Railly, telling him to get his hands off her and defending her as a doctor and psychiatrist.
Avoids eye contact with the detective who notices his slipped moustache.
Intervenes to protect Railly from the security officer, asserting her innocence confidently.
Momentarily distracted by the detective noticing his slipping mustache, avoiding direct eye contact.
Lunges at the detective and knocks aside security officers to pursue a threat aggressively.
Runs with a gun in hand through a crowded concourse risking others' safety in pursuit of Dr. Peters.
Responds quickly to danger and tries to intercept a potential threat (Dr. Peters), showing protective intent.
Lunges at the second detective, knocking him off balance, then sprints through the magnetic arch despite alarm sounding, showing decisiveness and physical capability.
Knocks aside the first security officer like a rag doll, demonstrating physical strength and assertiveness under pressure.
Pulls out his pistol and sprints toward a dangerous individual carrying a deadly virus, showing readiness and courage in a high-risk situation.
Fails to communicate or coordinate with police officers and security effectively in a chaotic environment, potentially increasing danger and confusion.
Tenderly touches the cheek of the woman ministering to his wound, showing vulnerable connection despite injury.
Sneaks another look back at the scene despite being hurried away, tears welling in his eyes, showing emotional sensitivity and connection.
